## GAD-7 vs WEMWBS

Comparing GAD-7 vs WEMWBS can be challenging and time-consuming for psychologists. These two instruments, both thoroughly used for psychological assessment, contain diversified items that require careful analysis. GAD-7, or the Generalised Anxiety Disorder Assessment, focuses on symptoms of anxiety over the past two weeks, whereas WEMWBS, the Warwickâ€“Edinburgh Mental Wellbeing Scale, assesses aspects of positive mental health. Using traditional methods, comparing items between these two can be a tedious task; however, Harmony simplifies this process drastically. Harmony, a cutting-edge tool for social scientists and psychologists, deploys natural language processing and AI technology to harmonise questionnaire items like those found in GAD-7 vs WEMWBS. Allowing users to upload PDFs of the tools or select from a database, Harmony can provide a percentage match between each item in GAD-7 and WEMWBS swiftly. Even multilingual comparisons are made possible with Harmony's language capabilities. In the quest to comprehend the nuances and subtleties of mental health, comparing instruments like GAD-7 vs WEMWBS is a must. The Harmony tool accelerates and eases this process, proving invaluable for psychologists worldwide. Visit Harmony's web interface at https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app to start your GAD-7 vs WEMWBS comparison today.

## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
